meanings.definition: The act of firing a shotgun.
meanings.sent1: During the hunting trip, he practiced shotgunning to improve his aim.
meanings.sent2: The sound of shotgunning echoed through the forest as the hunters aimed at their targets.
meanings.sent3: The old farmer joked that his scarecrow was shotgunning away any pesky birds that came near.
meanings.sent4: The burst of feathers in the air resembled the aftermath of a rapid shotgunning of the sky.
meanings.sent5: The instructor demonstrated proper shotgunning technique to the new recruits.

meanings.definition: The act of consuming a beverage quickly by puncturing a hole in the can or bottle.
meanings.sent1: At the party, they enjoyed shotgunning their sodas for a fun challenge.
meanings.sent2: She won the contest by shotgunning her energy drink in record time.
meanings.sent3: The friends laughed as they attempted shotgunning their drinks, causing spills everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The soda sprayed everywhere when he tried shotgunning it with too much force.
meanings.sent5: The group of teenagers gathered around to watch the impressive shotgunning skills of their friend.

meanings.definition: The act of rapidly sending out multiple emails or messages.
meanings.sent1: The marketing team was shotgunning promotional emails to attract more customers.
meanings.sent2: He was shotgunning messages to all his friends about the upcoming party.
meanings.sent3: The boss was impressed by the employee's shotgunning of project updates to the team.
meanings.sent4: Her inbox was flooded with shotgunning of notifications from various apps.
meanings.sent5: The politician's campaign strategy involved shotgunning social media posts to reach a wider audience.
